definition: Formal offers, statements, or documents that propose commercial arrangements, financial terms, or business relationships.

positive_examples: The quarterly earnings report showed strong revenue growth across all divisions.
Our hotel package includes breakfast, dinner, and spa access for $299 per night.
The merger agreement stipulates that shareholders will receive $45 per share.
This meal plan covers all dining options on campus for the semester.
Unemployment rates dropped to 3.2% according to the latest economic indicators.
My bank statement shows the monthly service fee was waived this period.
negative_examples: The scientific hypothesis suggests that climate change affects migration patterns.
Her moral philosophy emphasizes the importance of individual responsibility.
The mathematical theorem states that parallel lines never intersect.
This recipe calls for two cups of flour and three eggs.
The weather forecast predicts rain for the next three days.
His political manifesto outlines plans for healthcare reform.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: ScientificProposition, PhilosophicalProposition, MathematicalProposition, PoliticalProposition
